@spreadsheetben @harrytlambert @NewStatesman Of those 50,000, around 37,000 have been attributed to Covid-19, leaving near 13,000 as yet unknown. They may be undiagnosed cases of Covid, or may be caused by lockdown, be it not accessing medication or attending a hospital appointment.

Last night we tweeted (and now deleted) a commissioned poll on Scottish independence.

This survey, with Yes at 43% and No at 46% came with a key caveat: "these figures are not weighted for voter turnout" and "are not directly comparable with previous polls on the subject."

As such, this survey will not feature in the Britain Elects poll tracker.

Curious decision for a publication to run the non-turnout weighted figures.

‚ú® TWITTER POLL ‚ú®

Who do you think bangs on about Scottish independence more? Unionists or nationalists?

After trawling through the data, we've actually (!) got the answer. We'll publish it later. But first, what do you think?

Hello. If Reddit's your thing, we're doing an AMA (Ask Me Anything) on r/UKPolitics from 12pm today. 

Polls, elections, maps, data -- whatever, pop us a Q in the thread:
https://t.co/AYuDg06rod
@smifffyd yes

The verdict:

From 1999 to 2021, nationalist MSPs were the authors of most (50.4%) mentions of Scottish independence...

BUT unionist MSPs were responsible for most mentions (53%) between 2016-21, despite being a minority at Holyrood.
